name: National Anti-Violence Helpline (NAVH)
audience: Anyone facing or reporting family violence or sexual harassment
emergency_escalation: Can 3-way Police 999 or deploy DVERT social worker
services: Risk assess, emotional support, safety plan, referrals

name: Singapore Police Force (Emergency)
services: On-scene protection, arrest powers, can activate DVERT

name: SCDF Ambulance & Fire
services: Ambulance dispatch, fire rescue; coordinates with Police

name: PAVE – Family Violence Specialist Centre
services: Casework, PPO help, trauma counselling, abuser program
intake: Phone self-referral or via NAVH / Police

name: TRANS SAFE Centre
audience: Families in east SG experiencing DV
services: Safety planning, legal referral, shelter linkage
intake: Phone or referral; visits by appt

name: Care Corner Project StART
services: Risk assessment, counselling, court liaison

name: AWARE Women’s Helpline
audience: Women facing DV, sexual or marital issues
services: Emotional support, PPO info, legal clinic booking

name: AWARE Sexual Assault Care Centre (SACC)
services: Helpline, forensic exam support, court befrienders

name: MSF Child Protective Service (via NAVH)
audience: Public or professionals reporting child abuse
services: Investigation, safety orders, possible removal

name: Big Love Child Protection Specialist Centre
services: Family work, parenting support, monitoring
intake: Referral from MSF / Police; consults welcome

name: HEART @ Fei Yue CPSC
audience: Families & victims of child abuse or neglect
services: Risk assess, therapy, community resources

name: Tinkle Friend
audience: Primary-school kids needing a safe listener
services: Support, advice, can escalate to CPS

name: Samaritans of Singapore (SOS)
audience: Anyone in crisis or suicidal distress
services: Active listening, suicide risk SAFETY plan, referral

name: IMH Mental Health Helpline
services: Psych advice, may direct to IMH A&E

name: Care Corner Counselling Hotline
services: Talk-through, basic coping, DV referrals

name: TOUCHline
services: Youth issues, cyber-wellness, abuse guidance

name: Silver Ribbon MH Helpline
services: Advice, referral to affordable therapy

name: SingHealth Care Line
services: Befriending, daily check-in, links to APS

name: Family Service Centres (FSC) – ComCare
services: Counselling, safety plan, financial aid, shelter referral

name: Star Shelter (SCWO)
services: Safe housing, counselling, micro-loans

name: Casa Raudha Women Home
services: Shelter, religious-sensitive care, family programs

name: Good Shepherd Centre
services: Housing, trauma care, reintegration support

name: Pertapis Centre for Women & Girls
services: Shelter, religious guidance, skills training

name: Legal Aid Bureau (LAB)
services: Lawyer for PPO, divorce, maintenance

name: Community Legal Clinics (Pro Bono SG)
services: 20-min advice, Syariah & migrant sessions

name: Community Justice Centre (CJC)
services: Form filling, lawyer-on-duty scheme, victim support

name: Maintenance Support Central (MSC)
services: Enforcement filing, mediation, legal info

name: Adult Protective Service (APS)
audience: Adults (18+) with mental or physical infirmity who face abuse, neglect, or self-neglect; professionals or public wishing to report such cases
hours: 24/7 through NAVH; APS office hours Mon-Fri 08:30-17:30
services: Risk assessment and investigation, statutory protection orders, emergency removal to safe care, coordinated case management, caregiver and social support referrals
emergency_escalation: Works with Police 999, SCDF 995 and DVERT for on-scene interventions
intake: Reports accepted via NAVH hotline/web form, Police referral or healthcare/social-service professionals
